subject: Sleep
title: Birds That Sleep While Flying
description: A quick, practical guide to Birds That Sleep While Flying.

hook.text: Frigatebirds fly over the ocean for weeks without landing. They sleep in ten-second bursts while soaring on air currents.

buildup.text: Like dolphins, birds can use unihemispheric sleep, resting one brain half while the other navigates.

discovery.text: EEG recordings on flying frigatebirds showed they sleep only 42 minutes per day in flight, versus 12 hours on land.

twist.text: They even enter brief REM sleep while flying, during which muscle tone drops and their heads nod for seconds.

climax.text: The fact that they survive on 42 minutes of flight sleep challenges everything we thought about minimum sleep needs.

punchline.text: Some birds literally sleep on the wing.

quiz.question: How much sleep do frigatebirds get per day while flying?
options: They don't sleep at all in flight
